legendaryGroup.name: Amethyst Dragon
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The dragon stomps its foot, creating an earth tremors in a 40-foot radius around it. Each creature other than the dragon in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 bludgeoning damage and fall prone. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared.

The dragon causes two amethyst pillars to rise from the earth within 120 feet of it. The pillars crumble to rubble when this action is used again. The effect is otherwise identical to the {@spell bones of the earth|XGE} spell (spell save DC 15).

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a legendary amethyst dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's psionic power, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Small stones and boulders gather into cairns atop places where a person has fallen in battle within 6 miles of the dragon's lair. The size of the cairn reflects the magnitude of the sorrow caused by the person's loss. The stones have perfect balance, even in an earthquake.

Rings of small amethyst stones with a radius of 100 feet appear within 1 mile of the dragon's lair. Weapons cannot be drawn while its bearer is within this area, and damage-dealing spells fail instantly.

regionalEffects: The stones remain after the dragon's death, though their magical effects end immediately.

legendaryGroup.name: Crystal Dragon
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Crystal shackles fly toward a creature the dragon can see within 120 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained. This effect lasts until the dragon uses this lair action again or the target breaks free with a DC 16 Strength (Athletics) check.

A strong wind blows around the dragon. Each creature within 60 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the dragon and knocked prone. Gases and vapors are dispersed by the wind and unprotected flames are extinguished. Protected flames, such as lanterns, have a 50 percent chance of being extinguished.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a legendary crystal dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's psionic power, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Thick clouds heavily obscure the land within a half-mile of the dragon's lair (though not inside its lair).
Islands of scintillating crystal with AC 10 and 50 hit points float around the dragon's mountain, plummeting to the ground if damaged.
While within 1 mile of the dragon's lair, Tiny beasts such as rodents and birds gain the ability to communicate telepathically with other creatures within 60 feet.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, the clouds fade within 1 day. The other effects disappear over 1d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Emerald Dragon
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The dragon creates fog as though it had cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell. The fog lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round.

A column of wind 60 feet tall and 20 feet wide appears within 120 feet of the dragon and lifts up scattered scales, creatures, and debris. The wind lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. Any Large or smaller creature that starts its turn in the column or enters it for the first time on its turn must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be thrown 60 feet into the air and take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) falling damage.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a legendary emerald dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's psionic power, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Chill fog lightly obscures the land within 6 miles of the dragon's lair, and apparitions of legendary figures the dragon has studied caution intruders against approaching the dragon's lair.
Spires of pure emerald grow from the earth within 1 mile of the dragon's lair. Creatures that touch a spire have advantage on Intelligence (History) checks for the next hour.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, the fog fades within 1 day. The other effects disappear over 1d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Sapphire Dragon
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The dragon glimpses the future, granting it advantage on all saving throws until initiative count 20 on the next round.

The dragon chooses a point on the ground within 60 feet. Sapphire spikes sprout from the ground in a 20-foot radius centered on that point. The effect is otherwise identical to the spike growth spell and lasts until the dragon uses this lair action again or until the dragon dies.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a legendary sapphire dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's psionic power, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Statues of monsters the dragon has slain emerge from the stone within 1 mile of the dragon's lair. Creatures adjacent to a statue hear the dragon's voice describing this creature's death.
Lattices of pure sapphire grow across tunnels within 1 mile of the dragon's lair. Each 10-foot section of sapphire has AC 5 and 50 hit points.
Images of the dragon's eye appear in natural stones within 6 miles of the dragon's lair. As an action, the dragon may choose to see through any eye as if using the {@spell clairvoyance} spell.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, the effects fade over 1d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Sardior
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Sardior takes a lair action while within the Ruby Palace to cause one of the following effects; Sardior can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: A {@creature Sardorian golem|GDoF 3pp} emerges from the quartz floor of his palace within 120 feet of Sardior and acts on initiative count 20. Sardior cannot use this lair action again until the golem is destroyed.

Sardior can shape up to 1000 cubic feet of ruby, creating walls, doors, passageways, or other complex shapes within the Ruby Palace. In combat, Sardior typically uses this action to create a ruby {@spell wall of stone} (spell save DC 20) that is 1 foot thick, 20 feet tall, and 50 feet long to protect himself against invaders. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 15 and 360 hit points.

Gravity reorients itself to Sardior's command. Creatures and unattended objects within the Ruby Palace treat the ceiling or a wall (Sardior's choice) as the floor and instantly fall to the new floor unless they have a flying speed, taking falling damage as usual. This effect lasts until Sardior takes this lair action again.

regionalEffects: The following effects are present around the Ruby Palace, as wisps of the Astral Plane follow it throughout the multiverse. If the palace remains in one location for at least one week, the effects spread to the surrounding region.

items: Trees and shrubs petrify, their bark transforming into stunning rose quartz and their leaves becoming paper-thin rubies.
Bodies of water at least 10 feet in diameter become Color Pools, like those found on the Astral Plane (see Dungeon Master's Guide, pg. 47).
Psychic winds batter the walls of the castle; roll on each Psychic Winds Table at the start of each day (see Dungeon Master's Guide, pg. 48).

legendaryGroup.name: Topaz Dragon
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The dragon creates fog as though it had cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell. The fog lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round.
A tsunami surges from existing water in the dragon's lair, as if the dragon had cast the {@spell tidal wave|XGE} spell.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a legendary topaz dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's psionic power, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Humid fog lightly obscures the land within 6 miles of the dragon's lair, and phantasmal images of ships the dragon has sunk sail through the mist.
Reefs of pure topaz grow in the water within 1 mile of the dragon's lair.
Whirlpools appear in the water within 6 miles of the dragon's lair as if the dragon had cast the {@spell control water} spell.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, the fog fades within 1 day. The other effects disappear over 1d10 days.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Planar Travel
entries: The dragon can cast plane shift without material components after spending one hour in uninterrupted meditation.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 ({@dice 2d10+10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 ({@dice 2d6+10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 ({@dice 2d8+10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Soothing Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the calm emotions spell (both effects) for 1 minute. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect is dispelled, or the dragon attacks, the effect ends and the creature is immune to the dragon's Soothing Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Explosive Gem
items.entry: The dragon spits an amethyst sphere up to 60 feet away. The gem explodes into razor-sharp shards in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@dice 20d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Kinetic Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales a beam of glimmering energy in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. The first object or creature of Large size or smaller in that line must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or become restrained until the start of its next turn. The amethyst dragon may telekinetically hurl any creature or object restrained in this way up to 120 feet in any direction, dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet traveled.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@dice 2d6+10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Planar Travel
entries: The dragon can cast plane shift without material components after spending one hour in uninterrupted meditation.

entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 ({@dice 2d10+8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 ({@dice 2d6+8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 ({@dice 2d8+8}) bludgeoning damage.

If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect is dispelled, or the dragon attacks, the effect ends and the creature is immune to the dragon's Soothing Presence for the next 24 hours.

Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@dice 18d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The first object or creature of Medium size or smaller in that line must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or become restrained until the start of its next turn. trait.name: Planar Travel

action.name: Bite

action.name: Explosive Gem (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The dragon spits an amethyst sphere up to 30 feet away. The gem explodes into razor-sharp shards in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@dice 4d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spell, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Planar Travel
entries: The dragon can cast plane shift after spending one hour in uninterrupted meditation.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Blinding Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 ({@dice 2d10+7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 ({@dice 2d6+7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 16 ({@dice 2d8+7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blinding Presence
entries: The dragon shines with internal light. Each creature within 120 feet that can see the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Blinding Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Razor Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales razor-sharp crystalline shards in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@dice 12d8}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Blinding Beam
items.entry: The dragon breathes a beam of blinding light in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1d4 rounds and 14 ({@dice 4d6}) radiant damage, or no blindness and half as much damage on a successful save.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@dice 2d6+7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Mesmerizing Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Tail

action.name: Grounding Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or fall prone. Flying creatures are pulled from the air and fall prone when they reach the ground.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Razor Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales razor-sharp sapphire shards in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@dice 28d4}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Frightful Screech
items.entry: The dragon unleashes a bone-rattling sonic pulse, affecting creatures in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@dice 7d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1d4 rounds.

entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@dice 2d6+7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 ({@dice 1d10+4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Razor Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The dragon exhales razor-sharp topaz shards in a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@dice 6d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Divine Resurrection
entries: When Sardior dies, his body vanishes in a shower of ruby scales and his essence merges with that of his oldest thane (Hrodel). This thane retreats to safety and begins the slow transformation into Sardior, retaining her old memories and gaining Sardior's. All remaining thanes instantly sense Sardior's death.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If Sardior fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless he wishes to be affected, Sardior is immune to spells of 6th level or lower. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical or psionic effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Sardior's weapon attacks and breath weapons are magical.

trait.name: Planar Travel
entries: Sardior can cast plane shift after spending one hour in uninterrupted meditation.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sardior can use his Awesome Presence. He then makes four attacks: one with his bite, two with his claws, and one with his tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 31 ({@dice 4d10+9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 23 ({@dice 4d6+9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +18} to hit, reach 25 ft., up to three targets. Hit: 27 ({@dice 4d8+9}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 26 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from Sardior.

action.name: Awesome Presence
entries: Perceiving Sardior's divine form overwhelms the minds of mortal creatures. Each creature of Sardior's choice that is within 240 feet of Sardior and aware of him must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or become incapacitated for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Sardior's Awesome Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6)
entries: Sardior uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Concussive Breath
items.entry: Sardior exhales concussive force in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@dice 20d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures reduced to 0 hit points by this breath weapon fall unconscious and are stable.

items.name: Radiant Breath
items.entry: Sardior exhales a blast of radiant light in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Constitution saving throw, taking 67 ({@dice 15d8}) radiant damage and becoming blinded for 1d4 rounds on a failed save, or taking half as much damage without being blinded on a successful one.

action.name: Fire Breath
entries: Sardior breathes fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@dice 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Energy Adaptation
entries: Sardior gains resistance to acid, cold, lightning, poison, or thunder damage until the start of his next turn.

legendary.name: Wing Attack
entries: Sardior beats his wings. Each creature within 10 feet of him must succeed on a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@dice 2d6+9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. Sardior can then fly up to half his flying speed.

legendary.name: Psychoregeneration (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Sardior restores {@dice 5d10} hit points.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Sardior's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 27). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
Additionally, Sardior can cast any spell of 6th level or lower on the bard or cleric spell list by making a DC 30 Intelligence (Arcana) check.

monster.name: Sardorian Golem
monster.languages: understands commands given in any language, but cannot speak

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The golem's weapon attacks and breath weapons are magical.

trait.name: Psionic Conduit
entries: When Sardior casts a spell with his Innate Spellcasting (Psionics) feature, he can treat any Sardorian golem on the same plane of existence as the spell's point of origin. If he wishes, he can also speak through the mouth of any Sardorian golem on any plane of existence.

trait.name: Psychometabolic Shield
entries: If the golem and Sardior are within 120 feet of each other, half of any damage Sardior takes is transferred to the golem.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes four attacks: one bite attack, two claw attacks, and one wing attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 ({@dice 2d10+6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 ({@dice 2d6+6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 ({@dice 2d6+6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Razor Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The golem exhales razorsharp quartz shards in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@dice 10d10}) slashing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
